str2: The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Full, filled with. Of uncertain derivation.
A prolonged form of the feminine of moichos; an adulteress.

word: their desire for sin is never satisfied;
str2: Not ceasing from, not abandoning (giving up). Unrefraining.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To allure, entice (by a bait). From the base of dolos; to entrap, i.e. delude.
(lit: unpropped), unsteady, unstable, unsettled. Unfixed, i.e. vacillating.
Cursing; a curse; meton: a doomed one. From kata and ara; imprecation, execration.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To train by physical exercise; hence: train, in the widest sense. From gumnos; to practise naked, i.e. Train.
Covetousness, avarice, aggression, desire for advantage. From pleonektes; avarice, i.e. fraudulency, extortion.
